ygData.subject: Re: Jackalstock
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You can t dual wield instruments... BUT there s a lute-looking thingy which is not really an instrument in-game; the Lisera Lute from Qeynos (Lore item so
ygData.messageBody:
>Message: 18
> Date: Fri, 4 Feb 2000 15:51:53 -0500
> From: "Robert Maze" <robert@...>
>Subject: RE: Jackalstock
>
>Hmmm since those are ALL/ALL and bards can dual wield their fists when
>punching with a mandolin/lute, can the same be said for monks? I have an
>18th level monk and that would be so damn cool to punch with one of those
>in my hand. Holding one in each hand would be even better. Sort of a
>testament to my bard. :)

You can't dual wield instruments... BUT there's a lute-looking thingy which
is not really an instrument in-game; the Lisera Lute from Qeynos (Lore item
so you can't wield two of them), which is free for anyone who bothers to ask
for it. It looks like a lute, feels like a lute, and is even called a lute,
but it doesn't affect Hymn healing rates and you can wield it in one hand
and a weapon in the other - for a brief time I ran around wielding a lute
and sword 'cause I loved the confused /tells I got.

"How do you DO that?"
"Bard magic - trickery and legerdemain."

I dunno about you folks, but I love finding stuff like this to do = )

Aloro Silvertongue (E'ci)
~Flying Brethren~
Fleet Footed Singin' Fool
